Package cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core

Interface EdgeFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDirectedEdgeFactory, DefaultEdgeFactory, DefaultNotDirectedEdgeFactory
    public interface EdgeFactory
    This interface defines factories for Edge. This allows to implement custom Edge creation functionality on top of an arbitrary graph; separating concerns of building the Edge objects from actually using these objects.

    There will be concrete implementations of this interface on each graph.

    Author:
    Javier Marrero

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Edge build​(Node<?> u, Node<?> v)
      A method similar to build(java.lang.Object, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Node<?>, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Node<?>, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Weight<?>) not taking the label parameter nor the weight.
      Edge build​(java.lang.Object label, Node<?> u, Node<?> v)
      A method similar to build(java.lang.Object, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Node<?>, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Node<?>, cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core.Weight<?>) but that does not accept a weight.It is provided as a convenience method for unweighted graphs, avoiding the explicit pass of the null parameter for the weight.
      Edge build​(java.lang.Object label, Node<?> u, Node<?> v, Weight<?> w)
      This method should build a new Edge instance given start and final nodes.If the node can't be constructed by some particular reason this method should return null.Neither the initial nor the final nodes may be null, but the weight can, in which case the result is an unweighted edge.
